results.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Clare Toeniskoetter, Nina Feldman, Mary Wilson, M.J. Davis Lin, Marion Lozano, Daniel Powell and Chris Wood
results.title: What Biden Miscalculated About His Classified Documents
results.abstract: How the president has handled the discoveries, and why the public was in the dark for so long.

results.adx_keywords: Television
results.title: Wanda Sykes Kicks Off ‘Daily Show’ Stint by Panning a Eulogy From Trump
results.abstract: Sykes ribbed Donald Trump for forgetting a Black woman he met several times and who supported him at rallies, “setting the Black race back 50 years.”

media.caption: Wanda Sykes joked that Donald Trump could only remember one Black woman at a time: “If he turns on the TV right now, he’ll be like, ‘Wow, Diamond’s hosting “The Daily Show”!’”

results.adx_keywords: Classical Music;Opera;Black People;Weight;Content Type: Personal Profile;Pulliam, Limmie;Carnegie Hall;Metropolitan Opera
results.title: He Quit Singing Because of Body Shaming. Now He’s Making a Comeback.
results.abstract: The tenor Limmie Pulliam, who made his debut at Carnegie Hall on Friday, hopes to break barriers for larger artists.

media.caption: Limmie Pulliam at Carnegie Hall, where he made his debut on Friday singing the title role in R. Nathaniel Dett’s “The Ordering of Moses.”

results.adx_keywords: Monterey Park, Calif, Shooting (Jan, 2023);Mass Shootings
results.title: All of the victims of the Monterey Park shooting have now been identified.
results.abstract: The 11 people killed on Saturday night at Star Ballroom Dance Studio were six women and five men who ranged in age from 57 to 76.

media.caption: A vigil in Monterey Park., Calif., on Monday for victims of the mass shooting at the Star Ballroom Dance Studio.
media.copyright: Mark Abramson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Convenience Stores;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Fugitives;Yakima (Wash)
results.byline: By Eduardo Medina and Christine Hauser
results.title: Suspect in Killing of 3 at Convenience Store Fatally Shoots Himself, Police Say
results.abstract: Jarid Haddock, 21, killed himself amid an hourslong police manhunt for him in Yakima, Wash., in connection with what they said appeared to have been a  random shooting.

media.caption: The police in Yakima, Wash., surrounded a residence associated with the suspect in a shooting in which three people were killed at a convenience store early Tuesday.
media.copyright: Emree Weaver/Yakima Herald-Republic, via Associated Press

results.title: Wet Wipes and Jell-O: How to Prep for Your First Colonoscopy
results.abstract: Millions of people get colonoscopies each year to screen for colorectal cancer. Experts share strategies that can make the experience as smooth as possible.

media.copyright: Lucy Hewett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Schiff, Adam B;Swalwell, Eric M;McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );House Committee on Intelligence;House of Representatives
results.byline: By Catie Edmondson and Karoun Demirjian
results.title: McCarthy Ejects Schiff and Swalwell From Intelligence Committee
results.abstract: In an act of official retribution for how Democrats treated Republicans when they were in the majority, the speaker barred the Californians from the panel, arguing that they were not fit to serve.

media.caption: Speaker Kevin McCarthy sought to punish Representatives Adam B. Schiff and Eric Swalwell, two favorite foils of Republicans who had played key roles in the impeachments of former President Donald J. Trump.

results.title: A Deadly Epidural, Delivered by a Doctor With a History of Mistakes
results.abstract: Inspectors found that an anesthesiologist at a Brooklyn hospital made numerous errors in administering epidurals. Some were life-threatening. One was fatal.

media.caption: Juwan Lopez, 26, posing for a portrait with his daughter, Khloe Lopez, 2, in front of a mural of his partner, Sha-Asia Semple, in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Workers' Compensation Insurance;Long Covid;Chronic Condition (Health);Labor and Jobs;Research;Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;Unemployment;New York State Insurance Fund;New York State
results.title: Long Covid Is Keeping Significant Numbers of People Out of Work, Study Finds
results.abstract: An analysis of workers’ compensation claims in New York found that 71 percent of claimants with long Covid needed continuing medical treatment or were unable to work for six months or more.

media.caption: A long Covid patient entering a hospital in Sacramento in 2021. The Government Accountability Office estimates that the illness has affected 7.7 million to 23 million people in the United States.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Decisions and Verdicts;United States Politics and Government;Barnett, Richard (1960- )
results.title: Jury Convicts Man Who Posed With Boot on Desk in Pelosi’s Office
results.abstract: Richard Barnett became one of the highest-profile defendants charged in the Jan. 6 storming of the Capitol after he was photographed with his boot on a desk in Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s office.

media.caption: Richard Barnett inside Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s office at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. He was convicted on eight counts on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Doomsday;United States International Relations;International Relations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Global Warming;Nuclear Weapons;Langsdorf, Martyl S (1917-2013);Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists
results.title: Doomsday Clock Moves Closer to Midnight Than Ever
results.abstract: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists set the clock at 90 seconds to midnight on Tuesday, citing the war in Ukraine as well as climate change, online disinformation and other threats.

media.caption: The Doomsday Clock and its annual warnings about the imminency of annihilation have generated some skepticism over the years and prompted debate over its purpose.
